intro: Atropis nuttalliana, commonly known as the Nuttall's atropis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its fruit is a dry, two-valved capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
